get.summary: Get a list of container groups in the specified subscription.
get.description: Get a list of container groups in the specified subscription. This operation returns properties of each container group including containers, image registry credentials, restart policy, IP address type, OS type, state, and volumes.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription. The value must be an UUID.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for this operation.

schema.description: The container group list response that contains the container group properties.

items.description: A container group part of the list result.

id.description: The resource id.

zones.description: The zones for the container group.

identity.description: The identity of the container group, if configured.

principalId.description: The principal id of the container group identity. This property will only be provided for a system assigned identity.

tenantId.description: The tenant id associated with the container group. This property will only be provided for a system assigned identity.

type.description: The type of identity used for the container group. The type 'SystemAssigned, UserAssigned' includes both an implicitly created identity and a set of user assigned identities. The type 'None' will remove any identities from the container group.

userAssignedIdentities.description: The list of user identities associated with the container group.

additionalProperties.description: The list of user identities associated with the container group. The user identity dictionary key references will be ARM resource ids in the form: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/{identityName}'.

principalId.description: The principal id of user assigned identity.

clientId.description: The client id of user assigned identity.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the container group. This only appears in the response.

secretReferences.description: The secret references that will be referenced within the container group.

items.description: A secret reference

name.description: The identifier of the secret reference

identity.description: The ARM resource id of the managed identity that has access to the secret in the key vault

secretReferenceUri.description: The URI to the secret in key vault

containers.description: The containers within the container group.

items.description: A container instance.

name.description: The user-provided name of the container instance.

properties.description: The properties of the container instance.

image.description: The name of the image used to create the container instance.

command.description: The commands to execute within the container instance in exec form.

ports.description: The exposed ports on the container instance.

items.description: The port exposed on the container instance.

protocol.description: The protocol associated with the port.

port.description: The port number exposed within the container group.

environmentVariables.description: The environment variables to set in the container instance.

items.description: The environment variable to set within the container instance.

name.description: The name of the environment variable.

value.description: The value of the environment variable.

secureValue.description: The value of the secure environment variable.

secureValueReference.description: The reference of the secure environment variable.

instanceView.description: The instance view of the container instance. Only valid in response.

restartCount.description: The number of times that the container instance has been restarted.

currentState.description: Current container instance state.

state.description: The state of the container instance.

startTime.description: The date-time when the container instance state started.

exitCode.description: The container instance exit codes correspond to those from the `docker run` command.

finishTime.description: The date-time when the container instance state finished.

detailStatus.description: The human-readable status of the container instance state.

previousState.description: Previous container instance state.

state.description: The state of the container instance.

startTime.description: The date-time when the container instance state started.

exitCode.description: The container instance exit codes correspond to those from the `docker run` command.

finishTime.description: The date-time when the container instance state finished.

detailStatus.description: The human-readable status of the container instance state.

events.description: The events of the container instance.

items.description: A container group or container instance event.

firstTimestamp.description: The date-time of the earliest logged event.

lastTimestamp.description: The date-time of the latest logged event.

resources.description: The resource requirements of the container instance.

requests.description: The resource requests of this container instance.

memoryInGB.description: The memory request in GB of this container instance.

cpu.description: The CPU request of this container instance.

gpu.description: The GPU request of this container instance.

count.description: The count of the GPU resource.

sku.description: The SKU of the GPU resource.

limits.description: The resource limits of this container instance.

memoryInGB.description: The memory limit in GB of this container instance.

cpu.description: The CPU limit of this container instance.

gpu.description: The GPU limit of this container instance.

count.description: The count of the GPU resource.

sku.description: The SKU of the GPU resource.

volumeMounts.description: The volume mounts available to the container instance.

items.description: The properties of the volume mount.

name.description: The name of the volume mount.

mountPath.description: The path within the container where the volume should be mounted. Must not contain colon (:).

readOnly.description: The flag indicating whether the volume mount is read-only.

command.description: The commands to execute within the container.

httpGet.description: The Http Get settings to probe

items.description: The HTTP header.

command.description: The commands to execute within the container.

httpGet.description: The Http Get settings to probe

items.description: The HTTP header.

privileged.description: The flag to determine if the container permissions is elevated to Privileged.

allowPrivilegeEscalation.description: A boolean value indicating whether the init process can elevate its privileges

capabilities.description: The capabilities to add or drop from a container.

add.description: The capabilities to add to the container.

drop.description: The capabilities to drop from the container.

runAsGroup.description: Sets the User GID for the container.

runAsUser.description: Sets the User UID for the container.

seccompProfile.description: a base64 encoded string containing the contents of the JSON in the seccomp profile

additionalProperties.description: The list of key value pairs associated with the config map of the container.

keyValuePairs.description: The key value pairs dictionary in the config map.

imageRegistryCredentials.description: The image registry credentials by which the container group is created from.

items.description: Image registry credential.

server.description: The Docker image registry server without a protocol such as "http" and "https".

username.description: The username for the private registry.

password.description: The password for the private registry.

passwordReference.description: The reference for the private registry password.

identity.description: The identity for the private registry.

identityUrl.description: The identity URL for the private registry.

restartPolicy.description:
Restart policy for all containers within the container group. 
- `Always` Always restart
- `OnFailure` Restart on failure
- `Never` Never restart

ipAddress.description: The IP address type of the container group.

ports.description: The list of ports exposed on the container group.

items.description: The port exposed on the container group.

protocol.description: The protocol associated with the port.

type.description: Specifies if the IP is exposed to the public internet or private VNET.

ip.description: The IP exposed to the public internet.

dnsNameLabel.description: The Dns name label for the IP.

autoGeneratedDomainNameLabelScope.description: The value representing the security enum. The 'Unsecure' value is the default value if not selected and means the object's domain name label is not secured against subdomain takeover. The 'TenantReuse' value is the default value if selected and means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same tenant. The 'SubscriptionReuse' value means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same subscription. The 'ResourceGroupReuse' value means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same resource group. The 'NoReuse' value means the object's domain name label cannot be reused within the same resource group, subscription, or tenant.

osType.description: The operating system type required by the containers in the container group.

volumes.description: The list of volumes that can be mounted by containers in this container group.

items.description: The properties of the volume.

shareName.description: The name of the Azure File share to be mounted as a volume.

readOnly.description: The flag indicating whether the Azure File shared mounted as a volume is read-only.

storageAccountName.description: The name of the storage account that contains the Azure File share.

storageAccountKey.description: The storage account access key used to access the Azure File share.

storageAccountKeyReference.description: The reference to the storage account access key used to access the Azure File share.

directory.description: Target directory name. Must not contain or start with '..'.  If '.' is supplied, the volume directory will be the git repository.  Otherwise, if specified, the volume will contain the git repository in the subdirectory with the given name.

revision.description: Commit hash for the specified revision.

diagnostics.description: The diagnostic information for a container group.

workspaceId.description: The workspace id for log analytics

workspaceKey.description: The workspace key for log analytics

logType.description: The log type to be used.

workspaceResourceId.description: The workspace resource id for log analytics

items.description: Container group subnet information.

id.description: Resource ID of virtual network and subnet.

autoGeneratedDomainNameLabelScope.description: The value representing the security enum. The 'Unsecure' value is the default value if not selected and means the object's domain name label is not secured against subdomain takeover. The 'TenantReuse' value is the default value if selected and means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same tenant. The 'SubscriptionReuse' value means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same subscription. The 'ResourceGroupReuse' value means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same resource group. The 'NoReuse' value means the object's domain name label cannot be reused within the same resource group, subscription, or tenant.

autoGeneratedDomainNameLabelScope.description: The value representing the security enum. The 'Unsecure' value is the default value if not selected and means the object's domain name label is not secured against subdomain takeover. The 'TenantReuse' value is the default value if selected and means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same tenant. The 'SubscriptionReuse' value means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same subscription. The 'ResourceGroupReuse' value means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same resource group. The 'NoReuse' value means the object's domain name label cannot be reused within the same resource group, subscription, or tenant.

systemData.description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.description: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

maintainDesiredCount.description: Flag that indicates whether desiredCount should be maintained when customer deletes SPECIFIC container groups (CGs) from the NGroups. In this case, new CGs will be created by NGroup to compensate for the specific deleted ones.

containerGroupNamingPolicy.description: Container Groups are named on a generic guid based naming scheme/policy. Customer can modify naming policy to add prefix to CG names during scale out operation.

prefix.description: The prefix can be used when there are tooling limitations (e.g. on the Azure portal where CGs from multiple NGroups exist in the same RG). The prefix with the suffixed resource name must still follow Azure resource naming guidelines.

placementProfile.description: Provides options w.r.t allocation and management w.r.t certain placement policies. These utilize capabilities provided by the underlying Azure infrastructure. They are typically used for high availability scenarios. E.g., distributing CGs across fault domains.

faultDomainCount.description: The number of fault domains to be used to spread CGs in the NGroups resource. This can only be specified during NGroup creation and is immutable after that.

resource.description: A reference to the container group profile ARM resource hosted in ACI RP.

id.description: The ARM resource id in the form of /subscriptions/{SubscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{ResourceGroupName}/...

revision.description: The revision of the CG profile is an optional property. If customer does not to provide a revision then NGroups will pickup the latest revision of CGProfile.

networkProfile.description: A network profile for network settings of a ContainerGroupProfile.

loadBalancer.description: LoadBalancer the CG profile will use to interact with CGs in a backend pool

backendAddressPools.description: List of Load Balancer Backend Address Pools.

items.description: NGroups load balancer backend address pool

resource.description: The Load Balancer backend address pool ARM resource Id.

applicationGateway.description: Application Gateway the CG profile will use to interact with CGs in a backend pool

resource.description: The Application Gateway ARM resource Id.

backendAddressPools.description: List of Application Gateway Backend Address Pools.

items.description: NGroups application gateway backend address pool

resource.description: The application gateway backend address pool ARM resource Id.

storageProfile.description: Storage profile for storage related settings of a container group profile.

items.description: List of file shares that will be created and mounted on CGs.

shareAccessType.description: Specifies how Container Groups can access the Azure file share i.e. all CG will share same Azure file share or going to have exclusive file share.

shareAccessTier.description: Access tier for specific share. GpV2 account can choose between TransactionOptimized (default), Hot, and Cool. FileStorage account can choose Premium. Learn more at: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storagerp/file-shares/create?tabs=HTTP#shareaccesstier

items.description: Container group subnet information.

id.description: Resource ID of virtual network and subnet.

volumes.description: Contains information about the volumes that can be mounted by Containers in the Container Groups.

items.description: Contains information about the volumes that can be mounted by Containers in the Container Groups.

shareName.description: The name of the Azure File share to be mounted as a volume.

readOnly.description: The flag indicating whether the Azure File shared mounted as a volume is read-only.

storageAccountName.description: The name of the storage account that contains the Azure File share.

storageAccountKey.description: The storage account access key used to access the Azure File share.

storageAccountKeyReference.description: The reference to the storage account access key used to access the Azure File share.

items.description: Container properties that can be provided with NGroups object.
The properties of the volume mount.

name.description: The name of the volume mount.

mountPath.description: The path within the container where the volume should be mounted. Must not contain colon (:).

readOnly.description: The flag indicating whether the volume mount is read-only.

items.description: The object that contains a reference to a Container Group Profile and it's other related properties.

containerGroupProfiles.description: The Container Group Profiles that could be used in the NGroups resource.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state, which only appears in the response.

updateProfile.description: Used by the customer to specify the way to update the Container Groups in NGroup.

rollingUpdateProfile.description: This profile allows the customers to customize the rolling update.

maxBatchPercent.description: Maximum percentage of total Container Groups which can be updated simultaneously by rolling update in one batch.

maxUnhealthyPercent.description: Maximum percentage of the updated Container Groups which can be in unhealthy state after each batch is updated.

pauseTimeBetweenBatches.description: The wait time between batches after completing the one batch of the rolling update and starting the next batch. The time duration should be specified in ISO 8601 format for duration.

inPlaceUpdate.description: Default is false. If set to true, the CGs will be updated in-place instead of creating new CG and deleting old ones.

properties.description: Describes the properties of the NGroups resource.

identity.description: The identity of the NGroup, if configured.

principalId.description: The principal id of the NGroup identity. This property will only be provided for a system assigned identity.

tenantId.description: The tenant id associated with the NGroup. This property will only be provided for a system assigned identity.

type.description: The type of identity used for the NGroup. The type 'SystemAssigned, UserAssigned' includes both an implicitly created identity and a set of user assigned identities. The type 'None' will remove any identities from the NGroup.

userAssignedIdentities.description: The list of user identities associated with the NGroup.

additionalProperties.description: The list of user identities associated with the container group. The user identity dictionary key references will be ARM resource ids in the form: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/{identityName}'.

principalId.description: The principal id of user assigned identity.

clientId.description: The client id of user assigned identity.

id.description: The resource id.

zones.description: The zones for the container group.

systemData.description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.description: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

maintainDesiredCount.description: Flag that indicates whether desiredCount should be maintained when customer deletes SPECIFIC container groups (CGs) from the NGroups. In this case, new CGs will be created by NGroup to compensate for the specific deleted ones.

containerGroupNamingPolicy.description: Container Groups are named on a generic guid based naming scheme/policy. Customer can modify naming policy to add prefix to CG names during scale out operation.

prefix.description: The prefix can be used when there are tooling limitations (e.g. on the Azure portal where CGs from multiple NGroups exist in the same RG). The prefix with the suffixed resource name must still follow Azure resource naming guidelines.

placementProfile.description: Provides options w.r.t allocation and management w.r.t certain placement policies. These utilize capabilities provided by the underlying Azure infrastructure. They are typically used for high availability scenarios. E.g., distributing CGs across fault domains.

faultDomainCount.description: The number of fault domains to be used to spread CGs in the NGroups resource. This can only be specified during NGroup creation and is immutable after that.

revision.description: The revision of the CG profile is an optional property. If customer does not to provide a revision then NGroups will pickup the latest revision of CGProfile.

autoGeneratedDomainNameLabelScope.description: The value representing the security enum. The 'Unsecure' value is the default value if not selected and means the object's domain name label is not secured against subdomain takeover. The 'TenantReuse' value is the default value if selected and means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same tenant. The 'SubscriptionReuse' value means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same subscription. The 'ResourceGroupReuse' value means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same resource group. The 'NoReuse' value means the object's domain name label cannot be reused within the same resource group, subscription, or tenant.

autoGeneratedDomainNameLabelScope.description: The value representing the security enum. The 'Unsecure' value is the default value if not selected and means the object's domain name label is not secured against subdomain takeover. The 'TenantReuse' value is the default value if selected and means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same tenant. The 'SubscriptionReuse' value means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same subscription. The 'ResourceGroupReuse' value means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same resource group. The 'NoReuse' value means the object's domain name label cannot be reused within the same resource group, subscription, or tenant.

The 'Unsecure' value is the default value if not selected and means the object's domain name label is not secured against subdomain takeover. The 'TenantReuse' value is the default value if selected and means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same tenant. The 'SubscriptionReuse' value means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same subscription. The 'ResourceGroupReuse' value means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same resource group. The 'NoReuse' value means the object's domain name label cannot be reused within the same resource group, subscription, or tenant.

autoGeneratedDomainNameLabelScope.description: The value representing the security enum. The 'Unsecure' value is the default value if not selected and means the object's domain name label is not secured against subdomain takeover. The 'TenantReuse' value is the default value if selected and means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same tenant. The 'SubscriptionReuse' value means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same subscription. The 'ResourceGroupReuse' value means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same resource group. The 'NoReuse' value means the object's domain name label cannot be reused within the same resource group, subscription, or tenant.

systemData.description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

maintainDesiredCount.description: Flag that indicates whether desiredCount should be maintained when customer deletes SPECIFIC container groups (CGs) from the NGroups. In this case, new CGs will be created by NGroup to compensate for the specific deleted ones.

containerGroupNamingPolicy.description: Container Groups are named on a generic guid based naming scheme/policy. Customer can modify naming policy to add prefix to CG names during scale out operation.

prefix.description: The prefix can be used when there are tooling limitations (e.g. on the Azure portal where CGs from multiple NGroups exist in the same RG). The prefix with the suffixed resource name must still follow Azure resource naming guidelines.

placementProfile.description: Provides options w.r.t allocation and management w.r.t certain placement policies. These utilize capabilities provided by the underlying Azure infrastructure. They are typically used for high availability scenarios. E.g., distributing CGs across fault domains.

faultDomainCount.description: The number of fault domains to be used to spread CGs in the NGroups resource. This can only be specified during NGroup creation and is immutable after that.

id.description: The ARM resource id in the form of /subscriptions/{SubscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{ResourceGroupName}/...

revision.description: The revision of the CG profile is an optional property. If customer does not to provide a revision then NGroups will pickup the latest revision of CGProfile.

loadBalancer.description: LoadBalancer the CG profile will use to interact with CGs in a backend pool

resource.description: The application gateway backend address pool ARM resource Id.

storageProfile.description: Storage profile for storage related settings of a container group profile.

items.description: List of file shares that will be created and mounted on CGs.

shareAccessType.description: Specifies how Container Groups can access the Azure file share i.e. all CG will share same Azure file share or going to have exclusive file share.

shareAccessTier.description: Access tier for specific share. GpV2 account can choose between TransactionOptimized (default), Hot, and Cool. FileStorage account can choose Premium. Learn more at: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storagerp/file-shares/create?tabs=HTTP#shareaccesstier

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state, which only appears in the response.

updateProfile.description: Used by the customer to specify the way to update the Container Groups in NGroup.

rollingUpdateProfile.description: This profile allows the customers to customize the rolling update.

maxBatchPercent.description: Maximum percentage of total Container Groups which can be updated simultaneously by rolling update in one batch.

maxUnhealthyPercent.description: Maximum percentage of the updated Container Groups which can be in unhealthy state after each batch is updated.

pauseTimeBetweenBatches.description: The wait time between batches after completing the one batch of the rolling update and starting the next batch. The time duration should be specified in ISO 8601 format for duration.

inPlaceUpdate.description: Default is false. If set to true, the CGs will be updated in-place instead of creating new CG and deleting old ones.

containerGroupNamingPolicy.description: Container Groups are named on a generic guid based naming scheme/policy. Customer can modify naming policy to add prefix to CG names during scale out operation.

prefix.description: The prefix can be used when there are tooling limitations (e.g. on the Azure portal where CGs from multiple NGroups exist in the same RG). The prefix with the suffixed resource name must still follow Azure resource naming guidelines.

placementProfile.description: Provides options w.r.t allocation and management w.r.t certain placement policies. These utilize capabilities provided by the underlying Azure infrastructure. They are typically used for high availability scenarios. E.g., distributing CGs across fault domains.

faultDomainCount.description: The number of fault domains to be used to spread CGs in the NGroups resource. This can only be specified during NGroup creation and is immutable after that.

autoGeneratedDomainNameLabelScope.description: The value representing the security enum. The 'Unsecure' value is the default value if not selected and means the object's domain name label is not secured against subdomain takeover. The 'TenantReuse' value is the default value if selected and means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same tenant. The 'SubscriptionReuse' value means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same subscription. The 'ResourceGroupReuse' value means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same resource group. The 'NoReuse' value means the object's domain name label cannot be reused within the same resource group, subscription, or tenant.

autoGeneratedDomainNameLabelScope.description: The value representing the security enum. The 'Unsecure' value is the default value if not selected and means the object's domain name label is not secured against subdomain takeover. The 'TenantReuse' value is the default value if selected and means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same tenant. The 'SubscriptionReuse' value means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same subscription. The 'ResourceGroupReuse' value means the object's domain name label can be reused within the same resource group. The 'NoReuse' value means the object's domain name label cannot be reused within the same resource group, subscription, or tenant.
